page.title: 19YOUNG PEOPLE (CONTINUED)
page.content: Whereas at the beginning of the century most people were born,lived and died in the same village this is no longer so. With considerable unemployment (nearly 4 million in the U.K.) people are forced to move where there is work. With bigger and more efficient machinery fewer and fewer men are needed to work the land. Children today expect their own bedroom or to share with only one sibling. Another striking change has been in eating habits. No more is food cooked for hours on a fire. An hour or so on an electric or gas cooker, or a few minutes in a microwave oven is all that is required. Sheep's heads, pigs feet and suet puddings are no longer in vogue- a world without beef-burgers, chips and fish-fingers is unimaginable. We have moved from bottling and salting food to preserving it in a freezer.
